alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 1:35AM MST until December 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, life threatening cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations from a dusting to 2 inches are expected through the remainder of the night and early morning hours. Blowing snow with 50 mph wind gusts is possible through the remainder of the advisory. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, northwest and west central Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure to wear multiple layers and cover exposed skin. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Also make sure to take an emergency kit including food, additional clothes, blankets and a flashlight. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
